description:
This file comprises three main records compiled for publication in the following:					

van Ommen, T. D. and V. Morgan (2010). Snowfall increase in coastal East Antarctica linked with southwest Western Australian drought, Nature Geoscience, Advance Online Publication, doi:10.1038/NGEO761				

The records are:					
1 - a primary Law Dome Accumulation series covering AD1248-2005					
2 - a alternate lower fidelity Law Dome Accumulation series over the same time-span					
3 - a derived meteorological data set - the "AZ3 Index", which is an Australian Sector Zonal Wave 3 index computed from NCEP Reanalysis data					

The Law Dome accumulation series are constructed from data from segments of 6 individual cores (and a pit) as follows:					

The data here are best values a the time of publication. Further coring will result in extension of the series beyond the present 2005 cutoff date, and may also lead to small changes in pre-2006 accumulation values as overlapping core segments provide for more robust estimates.					
            					
            					
Core	Date Started	Lat (S)	Lon (E)	Max Depth (m)	Years in Accumulation record
DSS Main 26/12/1987	66 46.183'	112 48.417'	422.6	AD 1248-1986
W0k	15/02/1996	66 46.567'	112 48.083'	36.1	AD 1963-1995
DSS97	10/11/1997	66 46.633'	112 48.683'	95.5	AD 1888-1995
S0k	29/02/2000	66 46.183'	112 48.550'	9.1	AD 1993-1999
DSS0405	31/10/2004	66 46.614'	112 48.417'	10.3	AD 1997-2004
DSS0506	8/11/2005	66 46.334'	112 48.430'	22.5	AD 1987-2004
DSS0506Pit 16/11/2005	66 46.175'	112 48.687'	1.6	AD 2005
title: Law Dome, Dome Summit South ice core accumulation composite series
